Description: Unifies several classic fractal / power-law phenomena into a single CMCC pattern with clean separation between fractal dimension and log–log slope.

systems.Description: Each row is a fractal or power-law system described in a common schema.

schema.name: SystemID
schema.Description: Primary key for the system.

schema.name: DisplayName
schema.Description: Human readable label.

schema.name: Class
schema.Description: High-level class: 'fractal' or 'power_law'.

schema.name: BaseScale
schema.Description: Reference scale x0 for iteration 0.

schema.name: ScaleFactor
schema.Description: Multiplicative change in scale per iteration.

schema.name: MeasureName
schema.Description: What the measured quantity represents (count, perimeter, frequency, etc.).

schema.name: FractalDimension
schema.Description: Fractal (Hausdorff / similarity) dimension where defined (geometric fractals). Null for purely statistical laws.

schema.name: TheoreticalLogLogSlope
schema.Description: Theoretical slope d(log Measure)/d(log Scale) for this system under the chosen definition of Scale.

schema.name: EmpiricalFitQuality
schema.Description: R² value from fitted model showing how well observed data fits theory.

schema.name: EmpiricalSlopeDeviation
schema.Description: Absolute magnitude of slope error from fitted observations.

schema.name: MeasurementNoiseLevel
schema.Description: Noise sigma parameter from measurement model for this system.

schema.name: DataQualityScore
schema.Description: Composite quality metric combining fit quality and slope accuracy.

schema.name: RelativeSlopeError
schema.Description: Slope deviation as a fraction of theoretical slope (percentage error).

schema.name: IsHighQualityFit
schema.Description: Boolean flag indicating excellent fit (R² > 0.99 and slope error < 0.05).

schema.name: ScaleRangeSpan
schema.Description: Total span in log-scale space covered by data (decades of scale).

schema.name: MeasureRangeSpan
schema.Description: Total span in log-measure space covered by data (decades of measure).

scales.Description: Generic log–log points for each system at multiple iterations / scales.

schema.name: ScaleID
schema.Description: Primary key for this scale measurement.

schema.name: System
schema.Description: FK to systems table.

schema.name: Iteration
schema.Description: Discrete zoom level or rank index.

schema.name: Measure
schema.Description: Y-axis measured quantity at this scale.

schema.name: BaseScale
schema.Description: Base scale looked up from parent system.

schema.name: ScaleFactor
schema.Description: Scale factor looked up from parent system.

schema.name: ScaleFactorPower
schema.Description: ScaleFactor raised to the Iteration power.

schema.name: Scale
schema.Description: X-axis variable: BaseScale multiplied by ScaleFactorPower.

schema.name: LogScale
schema.Description: log10 of Scale.

schema.name: LogMeasure
schema.Description: log10 of Measure.

schema.name: IsProjected
schema.Description: True if this data point is a projection/estimate rather than measured data.

schema.name: DataRegime
schema.Description: Data regime for this point: 'ideal' (constructed/projection) or 'measured' (noisy real-world measurement).

schema.name: MeasurementModel
schema.Description: Optional FK to measurement_models describing noise/cutoff/discretization used to generate or interpret this point.

schema.name: TheoreticalLogLogSlope
schema.Description: Theoretical slope from parent system for comparison.

schema.name: EmpiricalLogLogSlope
schema.Description: Empirical slope from system_stats for residual calculation.

schema.name: SystemMinLogScale
schema.Description: Minimum log scale for the system (for normalization).

schema.name: SystemMaxLogScale
schema.Description: Maximum log scale for the system (for normalization).

schema.name: SystemDeltaLogScale
schema.Description: Total log scale range for the system.

schema.name: ScaleRatio
schema.Description: How many times larger than base scale (multiplicative factor).

schema.name: LogScaleNormalized
schema.Description: Position within system's log-scale range as 0-1 value.

system_stats.Description: Statistical analysis of each system's log-log behavior, with rollups from scales and lookups to systems.

schema.name: SystemStatsID
schema.Description: Primary key for this stats record.

schema.name: System
schema.Description: FK to systems table.

schema.name: AnalysisName
schema.Description: Human-readable name for this analysis run.

schema.name: Status
schema.Description: Status of analysis: draft, validated, published.

schema.name: SystemDisplayName
schema.Description: Display name looked up from parent system.

schema.name: TheoreticalLogLogSlope
schema.Description: Theoretical slope looked up from parent system.

schema.name: PointCount
schema.Description: Rollup: Count of scale measurements for this system.

schema.name: MinLogScale
schema.Description: Rollup: Minimum log10(Scale) across child scales.

schema.name: MaxLogScale
schema.Description: Rollup: Maximum log10(Scale) across child scales.

schema.name: MinLogMeasure
schema.Description: Rollup: Minimum log10(Measure) across child scales.

schema.name: MaxLogMeasure
schema.Description: Rollup: Maximum log10(Measure) across child scales.

schema.name: DeltaLogMeasure
schema.Description: Calculated: Difference between min and max log measure (numerator for slope).

schema.name: DeltaLogScale
schema.Description: Calculated: Difference between max and min log scale (denominator for slope).

schema.name: EmpiricalLogLogSlope
schema.Description: Calculated: Slope of log-log line from empirical data.

schema.name: SlopeError
schema.Description: Calculated: Difference between empirical and theoretical slopes.

schema.name: FittedSlope
schema.Description: Fitted slope from inference_runs on observed data.

schema.name: FittedVsEmpiricalDelta
schema.Description: Difference between fitted slope (noisy obs) and empirical slope (ideal data).

schema.name: R2
schema.Description: R² fit quality from inference_runs.

schema.name: QualityWeightedSlope
schema.Description: Fitted slope weighted by confidence (R²).

schema.name: ResidualRMS
schema.Description: RMS residual from fitted model.

schema.name: NoiseSigma
schema.Description: Noise level parameter from measurement model.

schema.name: SlopeToNoiseRatio
schema.Description: Signal-to-noise ratio (slope magnitude vs. noise level).

schema.name: DeviationScore
schema.Description: Composite error metric from inference_runs.

schema.name: AbsDeltaLogMeasure
schema.Description: Absolute value of delta log measure.

schema.name: LogLogArea
schema.Description: Area in log-log space (product of ranges).

schema.name: DataDensity
schema.Description: Number of data points per unit area in log-log space.

schema.name: RelativeSlopeError
schema.Description: Slope error as fraction of theoretical slope (percentage).

_CMCC_Summary: Fractal dimension (where defined) lives in systems.FractalDimension. All scaling laws share the same log–log slope machinery via systems.TheoreticalLogLogSlope and system_stats.EmpiricalLogLogSlope.

_meta.name: ERB_veritasium-power-laws-and-fractals
_meta.description: Unifies several classic fractal / power-law phenomena into a single CMCC pattern with clean separation between fractal dimension and log–log slope.

measurement_models.Description: Measurement/de-idealization specs used to produce or interpret real-world (noisy, finite-size, discretized) scale records.

schema.name: MeasurementModelID
schema.Description: Primary key for this measurement model.

schema.name: System
schema.Description: FK to systems table (measurement model is typically system-specific).

schema.name: DataRegime
schema.Description: Regime this model describes. Usually 'measured'.

schema.name: ScaleRegime
schema.Description: Optional RegimeID this measurement model applies to

schema.name: NoiseType
schema.Description: Noise model applied to measures (e.g., lognormal multiplicative).

schema.name: NoiseSigma
schema.Description: Noise strength parameter (e.g., sigma in log space for lognormal).

schema.name: CutoffMinScale
schema.Description: Minimum scale included (finite-size / censoring lower bound).

schema.name: CutoffMaxScale
schema.Description: Maximum scale included (finite-size / censoring upper bound).

schema.name: DiscretizationType
schema.Description: How observations are discretized (none, rounding, binning, log-binning).

schema.name: DiscretizationParam
schema.Description: Parameterization of discretization (e.g., decimals=2 or binwidth=log2).

schema.name: MeanAbsoluteResidual
schema.Description: Average absolute residual from fitted model for observations using this model.

schema.name: OutlierCount
schema.Description: Number of outlier points (|standardized residual| > 2.5) in observed_scales.

schema.name: TotalPointCount
schema.Description: Total number of observed data points using this measurement model.

schema.name: OutlierRate
schema.Description: Fraction of points that are outliers (quality metric).

schema.name: EffectivePointCount
schema.Description: Number of non-outlier points (usable for analysis).

schema.name: ResidualRMSFromInference
schema.Description: RMS residual from inference_runs (total fit error).

schema.name: CutoffLogMinScale
schema.Description: Log10 of minimum cutoff scale.

schema.name: CutoffLogMaxScale
schema.Description: Log10 of maximum cutoff scale.

schema.name: CutoffRangeSpan
schema.Description: Range of observable scales in log units (decades).

observed_scales.Description: Noisy, finite-range, discretized observations of each system's scaling law. Mirrors scales but with DataRegime='measured'.

schema.name: ObservedScaleID
schema.Description: Primary key for this observed scale measurement.

schema.name: System
schema.Description: FK to systems table.

schema.name: MeasurementModel
schema.Description: FK to measurement model used/assumed for this observation set.

schema.name: Iteration
schema.Description: Discrete zoom level or rank index.

schema.name: Measure
schema.Description: Observed (noisy) Y-axis quantity at this scale.

schema.name: BaseScale
schema.Description: Base scale looked up from parent system.

schema.name: ScaleFactor
schema.Description: Scale factor looked up from parent system.

schema.name: ScaleFactorPower
schema.Description: ScaleFactor raised to the Iteration power.

schema.name: Scale
schema.Description: X-axis variable: BaseScale multiplied by ScaleFactorPower.

schema.name: LogScale
schema.Description: log10 of Scale.

schema.name: LogMeasure
schema.Description: log10 of Measure.

schema.name: DataRegime
schema.Description: Data regime. For observed_scales this is 'measured'.

schema.name: FittedSlope
schema.Description: Fitted slope from inference_runs for this system.

schema.name: FittedIntercept
schema.Description: Fitted intercept from inference_runs for this system.

schema.name: ResidualRMS
schema.Description: RMS residual from fitted model (for standardization).

schema.name: PredictedLogMeasure
schema.Description: Predicted log measure from fitted model.

schema.name: Residual
schema.Description: Vertical distance from fitted line in log-log space.

schema.name: ResidualSquared
schema.Description: Squared residual for aggregation into RMS calculations.

schema.name: StandardizedResidual
schema.Description: Residual in units of RMS (number of standard deviations).

schema.name: IsOutlier
schema.Description: Outlier detection flag (>2.5 RMS units from fit).

schema.name: ScaleRatio
schema.Description: Scale relative to base scale (multiplicative factor).

schema.name: AbsResidual
schema.Description: Absolute value of residual for aggregation.

inference_runs.Description: Inference outputs (fits and residual geometry) computed from observed_scales relative to each system fixed point.

schema.name: InferenceRunID
schema.Description: Primary key for this inference run.

schema.name: System
schema.Description: FK to systems table.

schema.name: DataRegime
schema.Description: Regime of the fitted data (ideal/measured).

schema.name: MeasurementModel
schema.Description: FK to measurement model used/assumed (nullable for ideal).

schema.name: FitMethod
schema.Description: Fitting method used (e.g., OLS on log-log).

schema.name: PointCount
schema.Description: Count of observed points used in fit (measured).

schema.name: TheoreticalLogLogSlope
schema.Description: Fixed-point slope for the system.

schema.name: FittedSlope
schema.Description: Estimated slope from observed data under FitMethod.

schema.name: FittedIntercept
schema.Description: Estimated intercept in log10 space (logMeasure = intercept + slope*logScale).

schema.name: SlopeDelta
schema.Description: Difference between fitted slope and fixed-point slope.

schema.name: R2
schema.Description: Coefficient of determination for the log-log fit.

schema.name: ResidualRMS
schema.Description: Root-mean-square residual in log10 space (vertical residuals).

schema.name: ResidualMaxAbs
schema.Description: Maximum absolute residual in log10 space.

schema.name: OrthogonalRMS
schema.Description: RMS orthogonal distance to the fitted log-log line in (logScale, logMeasure) coordinates.

schema.name: DeviationScore
schema.Description: Composite deviation score combining residual RMS and slope delta (units: log10 + slope).

schema.name: SlopeConfidenceInterval
schema.Description: Approximate 95% confidence interval for slope (simplified formula).

schema.name: MinLogScale
schema.Description: Minimum log scale in the observed data.

schema.name: MaxLogScale
schema.Description: Maximum log scale in the observed data.

schema.name: MinLogMeasure
schema.Description: Minimum log measure in the observed data.

schema.name: MaxLogMeasure
schema.Description: Maximum log measure in the observed data.

schema.name: LogMeasureRange
schema.Description: Range of log measure values.

schema.name: AbsSlopeDelta
schema.Description: Absolute value of slope delta.

schema.name: SlopeIsSignificant
schema.Description: True if deviation from theory exceeds confidence interval (statistically significant).

schema.name: OnePlusResidualRMS
schema.Description: One plus residual RMS for efficiency calculation.

schema.name: FitEfficiency
schema.Description: Quality per unit error (higher is better).

schema.name: NormalizedRMSE
schema.Description: RMSE as fraction of total log measure range.

schema.name: SlopeToTheoreticalRatio
schema.Description: Ratio of fitted to theoretical slope (1.0 = perfect match).

schema.name: OneMinusR2
schema.Description: One minus R² for adjusted R² calculation.

schema.name: PointCountMinusOne
schema.Description: Point count minus one (degrees of freedom).

schema.name: PointCountMinusTwo
schema.Description: Point count minus two (degrees of freedom for regression).

schema.name: AdjustedR2
schema.Description: R² adjusted for degrees of freedom.

schema.name: ResidualRMSSquared
schema.Description: Squared residual RMS for BIC calculation.

schema.name: LogResidualRMSSquared
schema.Description: Log of squared residual RMS.

schema.name: LogPointCount
schema.Description: Natural log of point count.

schema.name: BIC
schema.Description: Bayesian Information Criterion (lower is better fit).

scale_regimes.Description: Multi-regime analysis defining different scale ranges within systems where different slope behaviors may occur.

schema.name: RegimeID
schema.Description: Primary key for this regime.

schema.name: System
schema.Description: FK to systems table.

schema.name: MinLogScale
schema.Description: Minimum log10(scale) boundary for this regime.

schema.name: MaxLogScale
schema.Description: Maximum log10(scale) boundary for this regime.

schema.name: ExpectedSlope
schema.Description: Expected log-log slope within this regime.

schema.name: RegimeType
schema.Description: Type of regime: 'early_scaling', 'mature_scaling', 'crossover', 'cutoff', etc.

schema.name: RegimeSpan
schema.Description: Width of regime in log-scale units (decades).

schema.name: RegimeCenter
schema.Description: Midpoint of regime in log-scale.

schema.name: TheoreticalLogLogSlope
schema.Description: Global theoretical slope from parent system.

schema.name: SlopeDeviationFromGlobal
schema.Description: Local expected slope deviation from global theoretical slope.

schema.name: PointsInRegime
schema.Description: Count of data points from scales table within this regime's range.
